All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class HistApplet
extends java.applet.Applet
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener

An applet to allow remote viewing of Jam Histograms

Version:
0.5
Author:
Ken Swartz

Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initializes the applet. You never need to call this directly; it is called automatically by the system once the applet is created.
Overrides:
init in class java.applet.Applet

start

public void start()
Called to start the applet. You never need to call this directly; it is called when the applet's document is visited.
Overrides:
start in class java.applet.Applet

stop

public void stop()
Called to stop the applet. This is called when the applet's document is no longer on the screen. It is guaranteed to be called before destroy() is called. You never need to call this method directly
Overrides:
stop in class java.applet.Applet

destroy

public void destroy()
Cleans up whatever resources are being held. If the applet is active it is stopped.
Overrides:
destroy in class java.applet.Applet
